        The   City Journal                   JOURNAL                     
           (USPS: 114-540)                    OF THE                     
          Published Weekly                                               
          Under Authority of                                             
                                          Board of                       
      City Ordinance No. 30050                                           
         by City of St. Louis             Aldermen                       
       Parrie L. May, Register               OF THE                      
          1206 Market Street                                             
          Room 118 City Hall            CITY OF ST. LOUIS                
      St. Louis, Missouri 63103                                          
                                             REGULAR                     
  Yearly Subscription . . . . $30.00                                     
          IN ADVANCE                          SESSION                    
                                             2005-2006                   
  Copies for sale and distribution at                                    
        Room 118 City Hall                                               
                                        PRELIMINARY                      
                                            In observance of the         
      Periodicals postage paid at                                        
                                           New Years Day Holiday,        
          St. Louis, Missouri              the Board of Aldermen         
                                        did not conduct a meeting on     
 Postmaster: send address                                                
 changes to City Journal, Register's     Friday, December 30, 2005.      
 Office. 1206 Market Street, Room                                        
                                           The Board will resume         
 118, St. Louis, Missouri, 63103.               meetings on              
                                           Friday, January 6, 2006.      
   BOARD OF                                    
 PUBLIC SERVICE                                
          REGULAR MEETING                      
    St. Louis, MO - January 3, 2006            
      Present: Directors Visintainer, Suelmann,
 Siedhoff, Bess, Kincaid, Simon and President  
 Melton.                                       
      Absent: None.                            
      Minutes of the Regular Meeting of        
 December 20, 2005 were unanimously            
 approved.                                     
      The following documents were referred    
 by the Secretary:                             
          December 23, 2005                    
       To the President and Directors of Public
 Utilities and Streets: 110829, Newstead M.B.  
 Church, site improvements to N. Market and    
 alley (sidewalk, driveway and sewers) at 4370 
 N. Market in CB 3696 (Newstead, N.            
 Market).                                      
      To the Directors of Public Utilities and 
 Streets: 110830, SBC, place two cables from   
 the property of Majestic Stove Lofts on       
 Delmar, down the alley toward North 21st to   
 the SBC manhole on N. 21st, 110831, SBC,      
 place cable in multiple locations for the near
 southside IV project on Tucker, 13th, 14th,   
 Park, Rutger, Hickory, 110832, SBC, place     
 cable across Hickory just e/S. 13th..         
     To the Directors of Public Utilities and  
 Public Safety: 110833, George Saab,           
consolidate land at 4344-56 Dr. Martin Luther   
King in C.B. 3727, 110834, Desco Group,         
subdivide a tract of land being part of C.B.    
3026 and lot 4 of Loughborough Commons          
Plat 1 in CB 3030 at Loughborough and S.        
Grand.                                          
    To the Director of Streets: 110835, Ethel   
Hedgeman Lyle Academy, encroach with            
banners at 1509 Washington, 110836, Ethel       
Hedgeman Lyle Academy, encroach with pole       
banners at Washington/Lucas/Jefferson/23rd      
     To the Directors of Health and Hospitals   
and Public Safety: 110837, Kim's Kids, Inc.,    
to conduct day care at 720 N. Leonard,          
110838, JIA Mighty King Kids, to conduct        
day care at 4523 N. 19th                        
          December 27, 2005                     
     To the Directors of Public Utilities and   
Streets: 110839, SBC, place cable across        
Mississippi just south of Chouteau from alley,  
crossing Mississippi to feed Lafayette Walk     
Townhomes.                                      
     To the Directors of Public Utilities and   
Public Safety: 110840, Joe Hoeing, subdivide    
at 3415-17 Lemp in C.B. 1550, 110841,           
Greater Leonard M.B. Church, consolidate        
land at 1124-26 Benton in C.B. 361, 110842,     
Town and Country Homes, subdivide at            
1611-17 S. 11th in C.B. 403.                    
      To the Director of Streets: 110843, The   
Central Baptist Church, place banners on 11     
light poles on Washington/E.W. Huntley/         
Leffingwell.                                    
     To the Directors of Health and Hospitals   
and Public Safety: 110844, St. Joan of Arc      
Kid Kare, conduct a day care center at 3548     
Sulphur, 110845, BJ Tot Town Day Care,          
conduct a day care at 4217 N. Grand.            
          December 28, 2005                     
      To the Directors of Public Utilities and  
Public Safety: 110846, Walter Coleman, lot      
consolidation at 2025-27 S. Jefferson and 2023  
S. Jefferson in C.B. 1319.                      
    To the Directors of Health and Hospitals    
and Public Safety: 110847, Faith Infant         
Toddler Center, conduct day care at 8209 N.     
Broadway.                                       
      Communications, reports, recommenda-      
tions and documents were submitted by Board     
Members and action thereon taken as follows:    
               PRESIDENT                        
     Proposed contracts and bonds ordered       
approved as follows:                            
      Letting No. 8281 - Concrete and Brick     
Removal/Replacement and Complete                
Sidewalk Installation, SP-64 (FY06-CIP),        
Stika Concrete Contracting Co., Inc., Contract  
No. 19644                                       
      Letting No. 8288 - Residential Sound        
 Insulation Program, Part XXXIII at Lambert       
 Turner-Bailey, Inc., 410 Broadway, South         
 Roxana, IL 62087, Contract No. 19643             
      Addendum No. 1 to the plans and             
 specifications for Letting No. 8292 - East       
 Terminal Ticketing and Baggage Handling          
 System Modifications at Lambert approved         
 and made part of the original plans.             
       Addendum No. 1 to the plans and            
 specifications for Letting No. 8293 -            
 Kingshighway Viaduct b/t Penrose and I-70        
 Package C approved and made part of the          
 original plans.                                  
      P.S.A. No. 1022 with Crawford, Bunte,       
 Brammeier for Halls Ferry Circle Evaluation      
 and Conceptual Design approved and               
 President authorized to execute same.            
      DIRECTORS OF PUBLIC                         
  UTILITIES AND PUBLIC SAFETY                     
      7 subdivisions ordered approved, as         
 follows, subject to certain conditions: 110796,  
 Lindenwood Baptist Church, 6932                  
 Lansdowne in C.B. 5941, 110834, Desco            
 Group, Loughborough and So. Grand in C.B.        
 3026 and 3030, 110801, Civil Engineering         
 Design Consultants, Inc., Pestalozzi and Texas   
 in C.B. 1421, 110846, Walter Coleman, 2025-      
 27 S. Jefferson and 2023 S. Jefferson in C.B.    
 1319, 110842, Town and Country Homes,            
 1611-17 S. 11th in C.B. 403, 110841, Greater     
 Leonard M.B. Church, 1124-26 Benton in           
 C.B. 361, 110833, George Saab, 4344-56 Dr.       
 Martin Luther King in C.B. 3727.                 
      Application No. 110806, Bobby               
 Fischer, LLC, subdivide property in C.B.         
 1386 ordered denied, proposal does not meet      
 minimum lot size requirements per the Zoning     
 Code.                                            
       DIRECTOR OF STREETS                        
       3 encroachments ordered approved as        
 follows, subject to certain conditions: 110835,  
 Ethel Hedgeman Lyle Academy, banners at          
 1509 Washington, 110836, Ethel Hedgeman          
 Lyle Academy, banners on Washington/Lucas/       
 Jefferson/23rd, 110843, The Central Baptist      
 Church, place banners on 11 light poles on       
 Washington/E.W. Huntley/Leffingwell.             
  DIRECTORS OF HEALTH AND                         
 HOSPITALS AND PUBLIC SAFETY                      
       10 day care centers, 1 hospital and 1      
 nursing home ordered approved as follows:        
 110340, Casa Dia Montessori, 2725 Alhambra       
 Ct., 110549, Stella Maris Child Care Center,     
 5654 Delmar, 110629, YMCA Headstart,             
 4632 West Florissant, 110577, Urban League       
 d/b/a Mt. Zion, 1440 S. Compton, 110219,         
 Learning Corner Child Care & Learning Center,    
 5900 Page, 110629, YMCA Headstart, 4632          
 West Florissant, 110550, St. Cecelia Preschool/
 Daycare, 5410 Louisiana, 110586, Lutheran      
 Family & Children Services d/b/a Hilltop Child 
 Development Center, 6155 West Florissant,      
 108542, God's Creation Development Center,     
 5099 Union and file Application No. 108712,    
 duplicate application, 110369, LMW             
 Learning Center, 1500 N. Union, 110756,        
 Cardinal Glennon Memorial Hospital for         
 Children, 1465 S. Grand, 110395, Northview     
 Village LLC, 2415 N. Kingshighway.             
 ROOMING HOUSES AND HOTELS                      
     1 hotel ordered approved as follows:       
 110848, Marriot Hotel, 525 S. Jefferson.       
      The following documents were not listed   
 on the Posted Agenda: 269408-09, 269411-       
 18, 269421 and 269434.                         
     Adjourned to meet Tuesday, January 10,     
 2006 at 1:45 P.M.                              
                 Marjorie L. Melton, P.E.       
                 President                      
 ATTEST:                                        
                 Darlene A. Plump               
                 Secretary                      
            Office of the                       
       Board of Public Service                  
          City of St. Louis                     
       SEALED PROPOSALS will be received        
 for the Public Work Hereinafter mentioned at   
 the Office of the Board of Public Service,     
 Room 208, City Hall, until 1:45 P.M.,          
 January 24, 2006 St. Louis, Missouri time,     
 at which time they will be publicly opened     
 and read, viz:                                 
 JOBT TITLE: Residential Sound                  
 Insulation Program, Part XXXIV at              
 LAMBERT ST. LOUIS INTERNATIONAL                
 AIRPORT(R)                                     
 LETTING NO. 8294                               
 DEPOSIT: $17,600.00                            
       Plans, specifications and general        
 information may be obtained in the Planning    
 and Development Office, 13723 Riverport        
 Drive, 4 th Floor, Maryland Heights            
 Missouri 63043, from 8:30 AM to 4:00 PM,       
 Monday through Friday and upon payment         
 of FIFTY DOLLARS ($50.00) for each             
 package.                                       
      Purchased sets become the property of     
 the prospective bidder and no refunds will     
 be made. Information concerning this project   
 may be obtained by telephoning (314) 551-      
 5025.                                          
       Proposals must be made on blank forms    
 to be furnished by the President of the Board  
     8 - THREE LEAD AUTOMATIC                                                         
     EXTERNAL DEFIBRILLATORS                                                          
for furnishing the Fire Department per Req.                                           
98.                                                                                   
AMERICAN HEART ASSOCIATION                                                            
 TRAINING CENTER SUPPLIES                                                             
for furnishing the Fire Department per Req.                                           
114.                                                                                  
      STARTER AUX CONTACTS                                                            
for furnishing the Airport Authority per Req.                                         
276.                                                                                  
       BASEPLATE MOUNTED                                                              
         TURBINE MIXER                                                                
for furnishing the Water Division per Req.                                            
1413.                                                                                 
         CURB STOP BOXES                                                              
for furnishing the Water Division per Req.                                            
1445.                                                                                 
         SPREADING CHISEL                                                             
for furnishing the Water Division per Req.                                            
1472.                                                                                 
       CONTRACT FOR PIPE                                                              
    COUPLINGS & REPAIR CLAMPS                                                         
for a period of four (4) years from April 5,                                          
2006.                                                                                 
WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 22, 2006                                                          
         CONTRACT FOR                                                                 
       AUTOMOBILE/TRUCK                                                               
     CHEMICALS & FASTENERS                                                            
for a period of four (4) years from July 11,                                          
2006.                                                                                 
      Bidders are invited to be present at the                                        
opening of bids. Bid results may be available                                         
30 days following the date of bid opening.                                            
If you desire bid results, please include a                                           
self-address, stamped envelope with your bid.                                         
     The City of St. Louis desires to                                                 
purchase recycled products whenever                                                   
possible, especially items containing post                                            
consumer waste materials. If your company                                             
can supply recycled products, please provide                                          
information to this office.                                                           
     The right to reject any and all bids is                                          
reserved.                                                                             
                Freddie L. Dunlap                                                     
                Supply Commissioner                                                   
                (314) 622-4580                                                        
                www.stlouis.missouri.org                                              
 of Public Service, and must be submitted to        
 Room 208, City Hall.                               
       Each bidder shall specify in his proposal    
 in figures, without interlineations, alterations   
 or erasures, a unit price for each of those items  
 where so called for in the proposal, and shall     
 show the products of the respective unit prices    
 and estimated quantities. He shall also show       
 in figures bid proposals for all items on which    
 Lump Sum figures are requested, and, in            
 addition thereto, at the end of the bid the Lump   
 Sum for which he will perform all of the           
 estimated work, as requested by the general        
 requirements and covenants, specifications         
 and plans.                                         
      In case of a discrepancy between the          
 gross sum shown in the proposal and that           
 obtained by the addition of the bid prices as      
 applied to be basic items, the latter shall        
 prevail.                                           
      Each bid must be accompanied by a             
 Cashier's or Treasurer's Check of a Bank or        
 Trust Company in the City of Saint Louis,          
 Payable to the order of the City Treasurer,        
 for the amount of Deposit required, as             
 heretofore stated.                                 
     All work under this contract will be paid      
 for in cash, based on monthly estimates of the     
 work completed, less a retained amount of          
 ten percent (10%). The City will make final        
 payment, including all retained percentages,       
 within ten (10) days after completion of all       
 work and final acceptance.                         
     "The City of St. Louis hereby notifies all     
 bidders that it will affirmatively insure that in  
 any contract entered into pursuant to this         
 advertisement, minority business enterprises       
 will be afforded full opportunity to submit        
 bids in response to this invitation and will not   
 be discriminated against on the grounds of         
 race, color or national origin in consideration    
 for an award."                                     
       The contract shall provide that not less     
 than the prevailing hourly rate of wages in the    
 City of St. Louis as determined by the             
 Department of Labor and Industrial Relations       
 of the State of Missouri for each craft or type    
 of workmen needed in the actual construction       
 work on the site of the construction job herein    
 authorized, as well as the general prevailing      
 rate for legal holiday and overtime work shall     
 be paid to all workmen.                            
      All labor to be performed under this          
 contract shall be subject to the provisions of     
 Sections 290.210 to 290.340 inclusive, of the      
 Revised Statutes of Missouri, 1986.                
       The right of the Board of Public Service     
 to reject any or all bids are expressly reserved.  
      By order of the Board of Public Service,      
 December 20, 2005.                                       E. Smoot, Chairman                       
                  Marjorie L. Melton, P.E.

    PUBLIC NOTICE                                
        BOARD OF ALDERMEN                        
     The Housing, Urban Development and          
 Zoning Committee of the St. Louis Board of      
 Aldermen will hold a Public Hearing on          
 January 25, 2006 at 10:00 A.M. in the           
 Kennedy Room (208) in City Hall:                
        BOARD BILL NO. 312                       
           Introduced By                         
     Alderwoman Phyllis Young                    
      An Ordinance recommended by the            
 Planning Commission on November 2, 2005,        
 to change the zoning of property as indicated   
 on the District Map, from "D" Multiple-         
 Family Dwelling District to the "F"             
 Neighborhood Commercial District in City        
 Block 387.05, so as to include the described    
 parcel of land in City Block 387.05; and        
 containing an emergency clause.                 
         BOARD BILL NO. 326                      
            Introduced By                        
         Alderman Matt Villa                     
      An ordinance establishing and creating a   
 Planned Unit Development District for a         
 portion of City Block 2792 and a portion of     
 City Block 2832 to be known as the              
 "Mississippi Bluffs Planned Unit                
 Development District".                          
         BOARD BILL NO. 328                      
            Introduced By                        
       Alderman Joseph Roddy                     
      An ordinance establishing and creating a   
 Planned Unit Development District for a         
 portion of City Block 3884 to be known as       
 the "PARK EAST LOFTS Planned Unit               
 Development District"; and containing a         
 severability clause.                            
      BOARD BILL NO. 354                         
         Introduced By                           
 Alderwoman Kathleen Hanrahan                    
      An Ordinance recommended by the            
 Planning Commission on December 7, 2005,        
 to change the zoning of property as indicated   
 on the District Map, from "A" Single-Family     
 Dwelling District to the "C" Multiple-Family    
 Dwelling District in City Block 4982, so as to  
 include the described parcels of land in City   
 Block 4982; and containing an emergency         
 clause.                                         
        BOARD BILL NO. 358                       
           Introduced By                         
     Alderwoman Lyda Krewson                     
     An ordinance establishing and creating a    
 Planned Unit Development District for a         
 portion of City Block 3894 to be known as                                                                    duration of eligible lists may be secured at the   Mr. Larry Thurston, at (314) 551-5005, or

                                                                                                                                                                 January 10, 2006 - ADVERTISED BIDS
